request.description:
set {{access_token}} to be ID_TOKEN=$(gcloud auth print-identity-token) && echo $ID_TOKEN

limit_order_off means how much less than the current stock price you'd like to place the limit order at. For example, if the stock price is $100.00, setting limit_order_off to 0.01 would place a limit order at $99.0.

amplify is the floating point number to tell how much more or less of shares to buy. Setting it to 1.0 means no adjustments.

response.name: executed_trades

request.description: set {{access_token}} to be ID_TOKEN=$(gcloud auth print-identity-token) && echo $ID_TOKEN

Execute this curl when Pycharm is not running locally with an unused Authorization code {{code}}. To get {{code}}, execute the request of 'tradeStation authorization code' from Chrome browser. When the redirect_uri is localhost, the Chrome page won't show but the URL will have a query string code=***. Fill {{code}} with the URL code= query string; Start PyCharm debugging. {{code}} is authorization code which can be used only once to generate access and refresh tokens! hitting Send twice will cause tokens to have errors. If get_authorization_code method in cloud function or PyCharm is executed, {{code}} is used to generate refresh token thus can't be used again.

url.raw: https://signin.tradestation.com/authorize?response_type=code&client_id={{client_id}}&audience=https://api.tradestation.com&redirect_uri={{redirect_uri}}&scope=openid profile offline_access MarketData ReadAccount Trade Crypto&state=prod

query.value: openid profile offline_access MarketData ReadAccount Trade Crypto

request.description:
Don't execute this curl but copy paste the curl's url to Chrome browser to cause trade station sign-in to get the authorization code per https://api.tradestation.com/docs/fundamentals/authentication/auth-code/
Set {{redirect_uri}} to any Trade Station account registered redirect_uri. Contact ClientService@tradestation.com to register.
response contains access_token, refresh_token, expires_in. {{code}} is authorization code which can be used only once to generate access and refresh tokens!
Hitting send will stream content without seeing the response. Copy paste the curl command from the Code button.
set access_token environmental variable to be ID_TOKEN=$(gcloud auth print-identity-token) && echo $ID_TOKEN
